pr_title: chore: Make sure basic auth handler is called when plugin is configured

timeline.message: Make sure basic auth handler if configured is called when auth plugin is configured

timeline.bodyText: What happens if neither of these handlers is called (i.e., the jaasAuthHandler is present but an invalid auth header was provided, and no pluginHandler is present)? Do we appropriately fail the request in this case?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: Why do we always route to the jaasAuthHandler if no auth header is provided? Is it true that all pluginHandlers require the auth header to be set?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: This was to catch the case where no auth header was provided but we still want request to be rejected, but the fix in above changes this anyway.
replies.author: purplefox

timeline.bodyText: Should we change this to a more specific type, since the method only works if this first auth handler is for basic authentication?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: I don't have a strong opinion on this one.
replies.author: purplefox

timeline.bodyText: To confirm my understanding - this is what would handle authenticating/authorizing alternative credentials? (e.g. a bearer token like ccloud supports)
timeline.author: rodesai

timeline.message: Make sure basic auth handler if configured is called when auth plugin is configured
